sen.j: 歌人（かじん）とは、和歌や短歌を作る人のことをいう。
sen.e: Kajin means poets who write Waka (thirty-one-syllable poems) or Tanka (thirty-one-syllable poems, just like waka).
Kajin is a Japanese term used to refer to poets who write waka (thirty-one-syllable poems) or tanka (the most common form of waka).
"Kajin" is a Japanese term used to refer to poets who write waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) or tanka (thirty-one-syllable poem).
sen.cmt: Kajin にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。用語集の表記に従い、waka (thirty-one-syllable poems) をwaka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) に修正しました。用語集の表記に従い、tanka (the most common form of waka) をtanka (thirty-one-syllable poem) に修正しました（※）。※用語集では thirty-one syllables' poem となっておりますが、他のサイトを検索したところ、欧米では 'thirty-one-syllable poem' あるいは '31-syllable poem' という表記が一般的なようです。よって他の表記と併せて 'thirty-one-syllable poem' と表記させていただきました。参考：http://www.poets.org/viewmedia.php/prmMID/5793http://www.americantanka.com/about.htmlhttp://www.uk.emb-japan.go.jp/en/event/tanka.htmlhttp://www.vam.ac.uk/collections/asia/asia_features/japan/japanese_art_design/

sen.j: 近代以降の歌人の多くは結社文学での「結社」に所属し、その結社の雑誌に作品を発表している。
sen.e: After modern times, there has been a tendency that many tanka poets belong to an association as association literature has been common, and they publish their works in their own association magazines.

sen.e: On the other hand, there are many poets who specialize in contributing their poems to the readers' columns in newspapers and so on, and the term "contributing tanka poets" has gained wide recognition.
